hackathon-description-text: A total of $ 10,000 will be awarded to the top three projects by Toyota. Additionally, cash, hardware and software prizes will be provided by the hackathon's co-sponsors.
hackathon-eligibility:
Must be at least 18 years old to participate.
In order to participate in the event you must be registered on our EventBrite page.
All participants must sign our event terms and conditions agreement prior to entering the event space on Friday.
In order to be eligible for prizes, your app must at least in part make use of the Toyota API.
All team members must register on ChallengePost in order to have their project considered for an award.
Teams must be no larger than 5 people in size.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: The team that creates the best mashup of API.AI and the Toyota API will be awarded a $1000 cash prize.
The team that creates the best mashup of Pebble and the Toyota API with be awarded one Pebble Steel for each member of the winning team (up to 5 Pebble Steels).
The team that creates the best mashup of the SmartThings platform and the Toyota API will get three SmartThings kits which each include a hub and various sensors.
The team that creates the best mashup of the Twilio API and the Toyota API will be awarded one Automatic Driving Assistant device for each team member (up to 5 devices).

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=425 Broadway Street, Redwood City, CA 94063, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
1. Relies on Toyota APIs 

2. Degree of App Completion 

3. Relation to Interest Areas

4. Presentation Quality 

5. App Originality

hackathon-location-address: 425 Broadway Street, Redwood City, CA 94063, USA
hackathon-description-header: Create innovative solutions for the connected vehicle using our Toyota API along with our Five Great Co-sponsors!
